alert.note: Alert for Westchester (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 18 at 12:35PM EDT until July 18 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southern Connecticut and southeast New York, including the following counties, in southern Connecticut, Fairfield. In southeast New York, Rockland and Westchester. * WHEN...Until 245 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1234 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Around 0.5 to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Stamford, White Plains, Ossining, New Canaan, Tarrytown, Mount Kisco, Dobbs Ferry, Nyack, Greenwich, Harrison, Ridgefield, Wilton, Scarsdale, Hawthorne, Upper Nyack, Bedford, Yorktown Heights, Jefferson Valley, Rye Brook and Valley Cottage. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
